title: Juan Mata opens up on life under Jose Mourinho at Chelsea and Man United
text: Juan Mata opens up on life under Jose Mourinho at Chelsea and Man United JUAN MATA insists he did not fall out with Jose Mourinho at Chelsea and they have a positive relationship at Manchester United. PUBLISHED: 22:25, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 | UPDATED: 22:47, Thu, Feb 23, 2017 The Spain international was let go by Mourinho in 2014, despite being a popular player at Stamford Bridge. Chelsea accepted a Â£37.1million offer from United as he made the big Premier League switch. Mata has since become a fan-favourite at Old Trafford and proven his worth for Manchester United . Mourinho's appointment last summer caused some concern over the 28-year-old's future, but there are no grudges held or conflicting attitudes. Mata has been used regularly by Mourinho as a key creator in United's attack, with three trophies still achievable this season. GETTY Juan Mata has been an important player under Jose Mourinho at Manchester United Sometimes in life and football as well, changes comes. You have to embrace it Juan Mata "I think [Mourinho] understands what this club means," Mata told BBC's Premier League Show . "I think that's very important, to understand the history, the philosophy and what the fans are used to." The former Valencia star admitted moving to England was a gamble, and life appeared difficult under Mourinho at Chelsea. But on his Blues exit under the Portuguese coach, Mata added: "You know, sometimes in life and football as well, changes comes. You have to embrace it.
